Revered around the world for its Louis Comfort Tiffany collection, the Morse Museum is celebrating its 75th anniversary. Caption Honolulu mural artist bringing ’heavenly light’ to Florida Hospital 
Renowned mural artist Andrew Rose, from Honolulu, Hawaii, works on his latest project: a massive, 3-story mural entitled "Light," at Florida Hospital for Women, in Orlando, January 23, 2017. (Joe Burbank/Orlando Sentinel) 
Renowned mural artist Andrew Rose, from Honolulu, Hawaii, works on his latest project: a massive, 3-story mural entitled "Light," at Florida Hospital for Women, in Orlando, January 23, 2017. (Joe Burbank/Orlando Sentinel) Caption Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts Center 2017-2018 broadway season 
The 2017-2018 Broadway Season line-up for the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts. 
The 2017-2018 Broadway Season line-up for the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts. Caption Art event paints colorful cultural portrait in Loch Haven Park 
The first Arts for ALL Day event took place at Loch Haven Cultural Park on Saturday, February 4, 2017. The event featured more than 60 local artists, organizations, and included free admission to area museums. 
The first Arts for ALL Day event took place at Loch Haven Cultural Park on Saturday, February 4, 2017. The event featured more than 60 local artists, organizations, and included free admission to area museums. Caption Chita Rivera: 'From Broadway With Love' 
Chita Rivera talks about why she joined 'From Broadway With Love: A Benefit Concert for Orlando' before the show at the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts. 
Chita Rivera talks about why she joined 'From Broadway With Love: A Benefit Concert for Orlando' before the show at the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts. 
As he heard stories from his models — how they were afraid to let their boss know they were transgender, how they had to move to find a community that would accept them — Burke became increasingly determined to give them a voice through art. 
“Their stories weighed upon me,” he said. 
Burke knows Nude Nite is designed to be a fun experience, so he avoided preaching or confrontation in his photos. Still he hopes that as viewers look at his works, with their subtext of hiding behind facades or experiencing violence, they will take a moment to reflect. 
“The intention is to get people a little pensive or philosophical just for a moment, to let people think about all our struggles,” he says. 
Burke is convinced emphasizing similarities over differences will open people’s minds. 
“It was a wonderful journey on my part,” he says. “I hope it’s a journey other people will take.” Nude Nite What: Art exhibition focused on the human form. Must be 21 or older to attend. Where: Central Florida Fairgrounds, 4603 W. Colonial Drive, Orlando When: 6 p.m.-midnight Thursday-Saturday, Feb. 16-18 Cost: $25-$35
